meanings.definition: Decide on and fix a time or date for (an event or action)
meanings.sent1: Mom appoints the meeting for tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The teacher appoints the exam for next week.
meanings.sent3: The cat appoints her nap time right after lunch.
meanings.sent4: The sun appoints its appearance at dawn.
meanings.sent5: The clock appoints the start of the class with its loud chime.

meanings.definition: Assign a job or role to (someone)
meanings.sent1: The manager appoints Sarah as the team leader.
meanings.sent2: The captain appoints different tasks to each crew member.
meanings.sent3: The clown appoints the monkey as the assistant juggler.
meanings.sent4: The chef appoints the spices to enhance the flavor.
meanings.sent5: The director appoints the lead actor for the main role in the play.

meanings.definition: Name officially or choose to hold a position
meanings.sent1: The president appoints the new ambassador.
meanings.sent2: The board appoints a new CEO for the company.
meanings.sent3: The wizard appoints the frog as the royal pet.
meanings.sent4: The artist appoints the color blue to represent tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The queen appoints the knight to protect the kingdom.
